data.text:
Donna Miller, President and Founder

C3Workplace

Donna is a business and community leader, speaker, educator, and entrepreneur who is passionate about seeing small businesses thrive.

She has helped thousands of companies to start and grow by providing office space, virtual assistance, bookkeeping, educational programs and advisory services. She believes that companies should be a force for good and very much believes in the power of collaboration.

She is the recipient of numerous awards, is a sought-after speaker, an author and is grateful to be a servant leader in many volunteer and pro bono roles.

Victoria Isley, Chief Sales & Marketing Officer,

Bermuda Tourism Authority

Victoria Vic Isley is a passionate traveler, lover of food, water, wine & music, Carolina Girl, farmer’s daughter and more.

Isley joined the Bermuda Tourism Authority (BTA) as Chief Sales & Marketing Officer in June 2014, bringing two decades of destination marketing experience to energize tourism to the island. Based out of New York City, she works with a team to create BTAs integrated, global marketing and sales efforts. Isley participated in a core bid team to land the 35th Americas Cup sailing event for the island in 2017 and has since negotiated official destination partnerships with the US Open and the PGA TOUR. Along with a passionate BTA team and industry partners, Isley led the destinations sales and marketing efforts that turned around the islands tourism industry, marking four straight years of growth that started in 2016.

As a travel marketing professional with more than 20 years of experience, shes worked for destinations including the island country of Bermuda; Washington, DC; Tampa Bay, Florida and Durham, North Carolina. Solidifying her dedication to place marketing, she was Chief Operating Officer for Destination Marketing Association International (DMAI), the worlds largest destination marketing trade association, representing 600 organizations worldwide. She also operated as the Executive Director of DMAIs Foundation. In recognition of her accomplishments, Isley was named one of Hospitality Sales & Marketing Association Internationals (HSMAI) Top 25 Minds in Hospitality & Travel Sales Marketing in 2016, receiving the Gene T. Hassett award.

Isley served as Destination DCs Senior Vice President of Marketing & Communications for nearly a decade, leading the United States capitals new brand strategy, building research and strategy for organizational advocacy, and spearheading crisis communications. During her tenure with Destination DC, Isley was the organizational marketing lead for high profile initiatives including tourism recovery efforts following 9/11, the dedication of the National World War II Memorial and the inauguration celebration for President Barack Obama.

Prior to her tenure at Destination DC, Isley served as Vice President of Marketing for Tampa Bay & Company, promoting the site of the NFL Super Bowl, NCAA Final Four and NHL All-Star Games. As Director of Communications for the Durham Convention & Visitors Bureau, she launched one of the first websites in the country for a DMO.

A 1991 graduate of the University of North Carolina with a bachelors degree in business administration and marketing, Isley has served as a past chair of the U.S. Travel Associations research committee as well as a member of the board of directors for Public Relations Society of Americas Travel and Tourism sector.
